document_data.caption: Map showing Ethdale north of Telflamm.<ref group="note" name="map">Note there is a discrepancy between ''[[The Forgotten Realms Atlas]]'' and the maps presented in ''[[Unapproachable East (sourcebook)|Unapproachable East]]''. The 2{{nd}}-edition source shows the [[River Eth]] north of the [[River Flam]] whereas the 3{{rd}}-edition source has it to the south.
document_data.name: Ethdale
document_data.socrefs: {{Cite dragon/269/The New Adventures of Volo: Hin Nobody Knows|84}}
document_data.mainbody: '''Ethdale''' was a town near the mouth of the [[River Eth]] where it emptied into the [[Easting Reach]] in [[northeast Faerûn]], ''circa'' the [[1358 DR|Year of Shadows, 1358 DR]].<ref group="note" name="map" />
document_data.Geography: Ethdale was likely part of [[Thesk]] because it was south of [[Nyth]], a small city in Thesk, but it was north of the [[River Flam]], which was the unofficial boundary between the [[Great Dale]] and Thesk in the [[Forest of Lethyr]]. (See Gallery.)
document_data.Inhabitants: Around the [[1370 DR|Year of the Tankard, 1370 DR]], the population of Ethdale was mostly [[halflings]] and [[humans]] coexisting, with the halflings somewhat more prominent.
